subject: URGENT: Globe Account Suspended - Verify Now
body:
URGENT SECURITY ALERT

Your Globe Business account has been temporarily suspended due to suspicious activity.

We detected multiple failed login attempts from China. Your account will be PERMANENTLY DELETED in 24 hours if you don't verify your identity immediately.

CLICK HERE TO VERIFY: http://globe-com-ph-verify.online/secure-login

Enter your Globe credentials and OTP to restore access.

Failure to verify will result in:
- Account termination
- Loss of all data
- Service disconnection

Globe Security Team (URGENT)
DO NOT IGNORE THIS MESSAGE

phishing_indicators: Extreme urgency and threats (24 hours, PERMANENT DELETION)
Suspicious login attempts from China (fear tactic)
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Classic urgency-based phishing targeting Globe customers - uses fear tactics and fake domain to steal credentials. Real Globe never asks for OTP via email.
red_flags: Domain is NOT globe.com.ph - it's a spoofed lookalike
Legitimate companies never request OTP codes
Unrealistic threat of 24-hour account deletion
Poor grammar and excessive capitalization
Creates panic to bypass critical thinking
verification_tips: Check sender domain carefully - 'verify.online' is NOT Globe
Globe never asks for OTP codes via email
Login directly to business.globe.com.ph to check account status
Contact Globe Business Hotline: (02) 16211 to verify
Hover over links before clicking to see real destination

subject: BIR: Tax Refund Approval - ₱125,000.00
body:
Bureau of Internal Revenue
Republic of the Philippines

Good news! Your company's tax refund has been approved.

Refund Details:
- TIN: 123-456-789-000
- Company: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES INC.
- Refund Amount: ₱125,000.00
- Tax Year: 2023
- Status: APPROVED FOR RELEASE

To process your refund, complete the verification form:
http://bir.gov-ph.online/refund/verify.php

Required information:
- Company TIN
- Authorized Representative Details
- Bank Account Number for deposit
- Mobile number for OTP

Refund will be released within 3 business days after verification.

Click here to claim: http://bir.gov-ph.online/refund

BIR Refund Processing Center

phishing_indicators: Unsolicited tax refund offer (too good to be true)
Requests sensitive information (TIN, bank account, OTP)
BIR doesn't process refunds this way
Asks for bank account number via form
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government impersonation phishing - exploits desire for tax refunds. Real BIR uses bir.gov.ph and never requests bank details via email links.
red_flags: Domain is bir.gov-ph.online, NOT bir.gov.ph (fake)
BIR never notifies refunds via unsolicited email
Requesting bank account details is huge red flag
Real BIR refunds go through official eFPS portal
No legitimate BIR reference number provided
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly bir.gov.ph (no hyphens or extensions)
Check BIR eFPS portal directly for refund status
BIR never requests bank details via email forms
Call BIR hotline: 8538-3200 to verify any refund claims
Real refunds require extensive documentation, not just a form

subject: BDO Security: Unusual activity detected
body:
Dear Valued Customer,

We detected unusual transactions on your BDO Corporate Account ****4892.

Suspicious Activity:
- Large withdrawal attempt: ₱450,000.00
- Location: Cebu City
- Device: Unknown smartphone
- Time: March 19, 2024, 2:15 PM

This transaction has been TEMPORARILY BLOCKED for your security.

Verify if this was you: http://bdoonline-banking.com/verify-transaction

If you don't recognize this activity:
1. Login immediately to confirm
2. Update your security settings
3. Verify recent transactions

Account will be locked after 6 hours if no response.

BDO Corporate Security
24/7 Protection Monitoring

phishing_indicators: Requests immediate login via provided link
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Banking credential theft phishing - uses realistic transaction details and security concern to trick users into entering credentials on fake site.
red_flags: Domain is bdoonline-banking.com, NOT bdo.com.ph
BDO uses online.bdo.com.ph for online banking, not separate domains
Real security alerts come through official BDO app
Suspicious transaction details designed to create panic
Time pressure tactic (6 hours)
verification_tips: Never click links in suspicious bank emails
Type online.bdo.com.ph directly in browser
Check account activity in official BDO app
Call BDO Corporate Banking: (02) 8631-8000 to verify
BDO never threatens account lockout via email

subject: URGENT: Update payroll information for March salary
body:
Dear Team Member,

Our payroll system is undergoing maintenance. We need all employees to update their bank account information to ensure March salaries are processed correctly.

IMPORTANT: Failure to update by March 22 will delay your salary payment.

Update your information here:
http://company-ph.com/hr-portal/payroll-update

Required details:
- Full Name
- Employee ID
- Current Bank Account Number
- New Bank Account Number (if changed)
- Contact Number
- Email Password (for verification)

This is mandatory for all employees. Process takes only 2 minutes.

Thank you for your immediate cooperation.

HR Department
Phalanx Cyber Academy Technologies Inc.

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Internal impersonation phishing - pretends to be from HR to steal banking and email credentials. Real HR never asks for passwords.
red_flags: NEVER provide email password to anyone, including HR
Domain is company-ph.com, not your actual company.ph
Legitimate HR uses internal systems, not external links
Real payroll updates don't require email passwords
Creates artificial urgency about salary payment
verification_tips: Contact HR department directly via phone or in person
Check if HR sent official memo through proper channels
Never provide passwords to anyone, ever
Real payroll updates handled through internal HR system
Verify sender email is from actual company.ph domain

subject: SSS: Employer account suspension notice
body:
Social Security System
Republic of the Philippines

IMPORTANT NOTICE

Your employer account has been flagged for unpaid contributions.

Employer: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES INC.
Employer Number: 03-1234567-8
Outstanding Amount: ₱87,450.00
Penalty if unpaid: ₱15,000.00

To avoid penalties and legal action:
1. Verify your contribution status
2. Submit payment immediately
3. Update employer information

Access your account: http://sss.gov.online/employers/login

Provide:
- Employer Number
- TIN
- Authorized Representative ID
- Mobile OTP

Deadline: March 23, 2024
Legal action will be taken if unresolved.

SSS Compliance Division

phishing_indicators: Threatens legal action to create fear
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government agency impersonation - uses fear of legal action and penalties. Real SSS uses sss.gov.ph and proper notification procedures.
red_flags: Domain is sss.gov.online, NOT sss.gov.ph (fake government site)
Real SSS sends official letters for compliance issues
SSS never requests OTP via email
Legitimate government sites use .gov.ph extension
Legal action threats without proper documentation
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly sss.gov.ph
Check contribution status directly at www.sss.gov.ph
Call SSS Hotline: 1455 to verify any compliance issues
Real SSS sends official correspondence via mail
Never provide OTP codes to anyone

subject: Microsoft 365: Payment failed - Service suspension
body:
Microsoft 365 Business Alert

Your payment for Microsoft 365 Business Premium has failed.

Account Details:
- Customer: Phalanx Cyber Academy Technologies Inc.
- Failed Payment: ₱21,875.00
- Attempted: March 22, 2024
- Reason: Card declined

Your services will be suspended in 24 hours if payment is not updated.

Services affected:
- Email (Outlook)
- OneDrive storage
- Teams
- All Microsoft 365 apps

Update payment method now:
http://microsoft-365.com.ph/billing/payment-update

Enter your admin credentials and new payment card details.

Time remaining: 23 hours

Microsoft Philippines Support

phishing_indicators: Asks for payment card details via email link
Microsoft never uses country-specific TLDs for billing
ai_analysis.educational_focus: SaaS credential theft - impersonates Microsoft to steal admin access and payment information. Microsoft uses admin.microsoft.com for billing.
red_flags: Domain is microsoft-365.com.ph, NOT microsoft.com
Microsoft billing always through admin.microsoft.com
Real payment failures show in Microsoft 365 admin center
Microsoft never requests credentials via email
Country-specific domain is suspicious for global service
verification_tips: Login directly to admin.microsoft.com to check billing
Microsoft sends billing alerts through admin portal
Call Microsoft Philippines: (02) 7793-5500 to verify
Never click payment update links in emails
Check credit card statement for actual charges

subject: Lazada: Your account has been compromised
body:
SECURITY ALERT

We detected unauthorized access to your Lazada Business account.

Suspicious Activity:
- Login from: Indonesia
- Attempted orders: ₱45,000.00
- Payment method: Changed
- Shipping address: Modified

We have BLOCKED these transactions and locked your account.

To unlock and secure your account:
1. Verify your identity
2. Review suspicious activities
3. Reset your password

Secure your account now:
http://lazada-ph.online/security/account-recovery

Provide:
- Email address
- Current password
- Mobile number
- OTP code

Account will remain locked until verification complete.

Lazada Security Team (Philippines)

phishing_indicators: Claims account compromise to create panic
ai_analysis.educational_focus: E-commerce account takeover attempt - uses security scare to trick users into revealing credentials. Real Lazada never asks for current passwords.
red_flags: Domain is lazada-ph.online, NOT lazada.com.ph
NEVER provide current password to anyone
Legitimate password resets don't ask for old password
Real Lazada security alerts show in app/account
OTP codes should never be shared
verification_tips: Login directly to www.lazada.com.ph to check account
Check for security alerts in Lazada app
Lazada never asks for current password via email
Contact Lazada Customer Service: 02-8820-8800
Real account recovery uses secure in-app process

subject: Mandatory: Email system upgrade - Action required
body:
IT Department Announcement

We are upgrading our email system to improve security and performance.

All employees must verify their email accounts by March 25, 2024 to avoid service interruption.

Verification process:
1. Click the link below
2. Enter your email credentials
3. Complete security questions
4. Download security certificate

Verify your email: http://company.support-ph.com/email-upgrade

Required information:
- Full email address
- Current password
- Security questions
- Mobile number

Failing to complete verification will result in:
- Email access loss
- Calendar data deletion
- Contact list removal

Complete by: March 25, 2024, 5:00 PM

IT Support Team
Phalanx Cyber Academy Technologies

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Internal IT impersonation - pretends to be from IT department to harvest email credentials. Real IT never requests passwords.
red_flags: Domain is company.support-ph.com, not company.ph
IT NEVER asks for email passwords
Real system upgrades done by IT without user passwords
Threatening data deletion is scare tactic
Legitimate IT uses internal ticketing system
verification_tips: Contact IT department directly via phone or helpdesk
Verify if upgrade announcement was sent officially
Real IT system upgrades don't require user passwords
Check with colleagues if they received same email
Report suspicious IT emails to actual IT security team

subject: GCash: Suspicious transaction detected - ₱50,000
body:
GCash Security Alert

We detected a suspicious transaction on your GCash Business account.

Transaction Details:
- Amount: ₱50,000.00
- Recipient: Unknown (09XX-XXX-XXXX)
- Status: Pending approval
- Time: March 25, 2024, 7:15 PM

This transaction is unusual for your account pattern.

If you did NOT authorize this:
1. Cancel transaction immediately
2. Verify your account security
3. Update your MPIN

Cancel transaction: http://gcash-secure.com.ph/cancel-transaction

Login with:
- Mobile number
- MPIN
- OTP code

Transaction will process in 2 hours if not cancelled.

GCash Security Team
Protecting your funds 24/7

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Mobile wallet credential theft - exploits fear of unauthorized transactions. Real GCash never asks for MPIN or OTP via email.
red_flags: Domain is gcash-secure.com.ph, NOT gcash.com
GCash NEVER asks for MPIN via email
Never share OTP codes with anyone
Real transaction alerts show in GCash app
Time pressure to bypass critical thinking
verification_tips: Open GCash app directly to check transactions
GCash security alerts appear in-app, not just email
Never provide MPIN or OTP via any link
Contact GCash Hotline: 2882 to verify
Real GCash always uses gcash.com domain

subject: PhilHealth: Update employer information immediately
body:
Philippine Health Insurance Corporation
Republic of the Philippines

IMPORTANT COMPLIANCE NOTICE

Your PhilHealth employer record requires immediate update to comply with new Republic Act requirements.

Employer: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES INC.
Employer Number: 1234567890
Status: NON-COMPLIANT
Penalty if not updated: ₱25,000.00

Update required information:
- Employer details
- List of employees with PhilHealth numbers
- Updated payroll information
- Authorized representative credentials

Complete update: http://philhealth-online.gov.ph.com/employer-update

Deadline: March 28, 2024
Non-compliance may result in suspension of employee benefits.

PhilHealth Employer Services
Compliance Division

phishing_indicators: Claims new RA requirements without specifics
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government impersonation with data harvesting - tries to collect employee personal information. Real PhilHealth uses philhealth.gov.ph only.
red_flags: Domain has suspicious .com after .gov.ph
Real government sites only use .gov.ph
PhilHealth sends official letters for compliance
Requesting all employee PhilHealth numbers is suspicious
Vague 'Republic Act requirements' without specifics
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly philhealth.gov.ph (no .com)
Check PhilHealth employer portal directly
Call PhilHealth Action Center: (02) 8441-7442
Real compliance notices come via official mail
Government agencies don't threaten via email

subject: Zoom: Your recording will be deleted - Download now
body:
Zoom Video Communications

IMPORTANT: Your cloud recording will be automatically deleted in 48 hours.

Recording Details:
- Meeting: Q1 Business Review - Manila Office
- Date: March 27, 2024
- Size: 847 MB
- Expires: March 29, 2024

Due to storage limits, this recording must be downloaded before expiration.

Download recording: http://zoom-philippines.com/recording/download/xyz789

To download:
1. Click the link above
2. Login with Zoom credentials
3. Verify account with OTP
4. Download file

After deletion, recordings cannot be recovered.

Zoom Support Philippines

phishing_indicators: Requests Zoom credentials via email link
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Video platform credential theft - uses fake recording deletion to steal Zoom account access. Real Zoom uses zoom.us only.
red_flags: Domain is zoom-philippines.com, NOT zoom.us
Zoom uses zoom.us globally, not country domains
Real recordings accessed through zoom.us/recording
Zoom doesn't auto-delete after 48 hours
Requesting OTP via email link is suspicious
verification_tips: Login directly to zoom.us to check recordings
Zoom cloud recordings have longer retention (days/months)
Never enter Zoom credentials via email links
Check recording management in official Zoom portal
Zoom always uses zoom.us domain for services

subject: UnionBank: Confirm wire transfer - ₱875,000
body:
UnionBank Corporate Banking

Wire Transfer Authorization Required

A wire transfer request has been initiated from your account:

Transfer Details:
- From: UnionBank Corporate ****7890
- To: International Account (Singapore)
- Amount: ₱875,000.00
- Reference: WIRE-2024-03-28-789
- Initiated by: Unknown user

This transaction requires your authorization.

If you did NOT initiate this transfer:
1. Cancel immediately
2. Verify account security
3. Report unauthorized access

Authorize or cancel:
http://unionbank-corporate.ph.com/wire-transfer/confirm

Login required:
- Corporate account credentials
- Transaction PIN
- SMS OTP

Transfer will process in 1 hour if not cancelled.

UnionBank Security Team

phishing_indicators: Large amount wire transfer to create alarm
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Banking wire transfer scam - uses fear of large unauthorized transfer to steal banking credentials and OTP codes.
red_flags: Domain is unionbank-corporate.ph.com, NOT unionbank.ph
UnionBank uses online.unionbankph.com for transactions
Real wire transfers show in online banking portal
Never provide transaction PIN or OTP via email links
International transfers require multiple authorizations
verification_tips: Login directly to online.unionbankph.com
Check for pending transactions in official portal
Call UnionBank Corporate: (02) 8841-8600 immediately
Never share OTP or transaction PIN
Real wire transfers require in-app authorization

subject: BPI: New security token required for online banking
body:
Bank of the Philippine Islands
Security Enhancement Notice

BPI is implementing enhanced security measures for all corporate accounts.

NEW REQUIREMENT: Security Token Installation

All corporate account holders must install a new security token to continue using BPI online banking.

Installation deadline: March 31, 2024

Install security token:
http://bpi-online.com.ph/security/token-install

Installation process:
1. Download security certificate
2. Enter corporate account credentials
3. Verify identity with OTP
4. Install token on device

Accounts without security token will be suspended after March 31.

This is mandatory for all BPI Corporate Banking users.

BPI Corporate Security Team
Enhanced Protection Initiative

phishing_indicators: Asks to download security certificate (likely malware)
BPI doesn't use separate domains for security
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Banking malware distribution - disguises malware as security token while stealing credentials. Real BPI security updates through official channels.
red_flags: Domain is bpi-online.com.ph, NOT bpi.com.ph or online.bpi.com.ph
Downloading 'security certificates' via email is dangerous
Real security tokens distributed through bank branches
BPI never requests credentials for security updates
Mandatory installation threats are pressure tactics
verification_tips: Visit BPI branch to verify security requirements
Call BPI Corporate: (02) 889-10000 to confirm
Never download security software from email links
Real BPI security uses official app and branch procedures
Check online.bpi.com.ph for legitimate security announcements

subject: SEC: Final notice - Submit documents or face penalties
body:
Securities and Exchange Commission
Republic of the Philippines

FINAL COMPLIANCE NOTICE

Your company has outstanding SEC requirements that must be submitted immediately.

Company: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES INC.
SEC Registration: CS202012345
Status: NON-COMPLIANT
Penalty accrued: ₱50,000.00

Outstanding requirements:
- General Information Sheet (GIS)
- Audited Financial Statements 2023
- Board Resolution
- Articles of Incorporation (updated)

Submit documents: http://sec-online.gov.ph.net/submit-documents

Upload:
- Required documents
- Penalty payment proof
- Authorized representative ID
- Company TIN

Final deadline: April 1, 2024
Failure to comply will result in SEC administrative case and business suspension.

SEC Compliance Division

phishing_indicators: Requests company TIN and ID documents
Asks for payment proof upload (credit card info)
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government impersonation for document/identity theft - harvests sensitive business documents and IDs. Real SEC uses sec.gov.ph only.
red_flags: Domain has .net after .gov.ph (fake government site)
Real government sites ONLY use .gov.ph
SEC sends official letters for compliance
Uploading representative ID to website is dangerous
Vague 'administrative case' threat without specifics
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly sec.gov.ph (no extensions)
Check SEC i-Register portal directly
Call SEC: (02) 8818-0921 to verify compliance status
Real SEC notices come via registered mail
Never upload IDs or TINs via email links

subject: MERALCO: Final disconnection notice - Pay now
body:
Manila Electric Company

FINAL DISCONNECTION NOTICE

Your MERALCO account has an overdue balance. Service will be disconnected in 24 hours.

Account Number: 1234-5678-90
Service Address: 123 Ayala Avenue, Makati City
Overdue Amount: ₱45,673.25
Penalty: ₱5,000.00
Total Due: ₱50,673.25

Disconnection Date: April 1, 2024, 9:00 AM

Pay immediately to avoid disconnection:
http://meralco-billing.com.ph/pay-now

Payment options:
- Credit Card
- Debit Card
- Online Banking

Provide:
- Account number
- Payment amount
- Card details

Disconnection cannot be reversed once executed.

MERALCO Collection Department
URGENT ACTION REQUIRED

phishing_indicators: Requests credit card details via email link
Adds penalty to create larger amount
MERALCO doesn't use separate billing domains
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Utility billing scam - uses fear of service disconnection to steal payment card information. Real MERALCO has proper procedures.
red_flags: Domain is meralco-billing.com.ph, NOT meralco.com.ph
Real MERALCO uses app.meralco.com.ph for payments
MERALCO sends physical disconnection notices
Never provide card details via email links
24-hour disconnection is unrealistic
verification_tips: Login to app.meralco.com.ph to check actual bill
Call MERALCO Hotline: (02) 16211 to verify
Real disconnection notices come via registered mail
Pay only through official MERALCO channels
Check MERALCO app for real account status

subject: URGENT: Wire transfer needed for client payment
body:
Hi Finance Team,

I need you to process an urgent wire transfer immediately. I'm in a meeting with our biggest client in Singapore and can't access my computer.

Transfer Details:
- Amount: ₱500,000.00
- Recipient: TechSupply Solutions Pte Ltd
- Bank: DBS Bank Singapore
- Account: 1234567890
- Swift: DBSSSGSG
- Reference: Invoice #SG-2024-789

This is for equipment we need by tomorrow. The client is waiting for payment confirmation.

Please process this immediately and send me confirmation at this email.

Don't call my regular number - I'm using a client phone. Will explain later.

Thanks,
CEO Name
Sent from my iPhone

ai_analysis.educational_focus: CEO fraud/Business Email Compromise - impersonates executive to authorize fraudulent wire transfer. Classic BEC attack targeting finance departments.
red_flags: Sender domain is company-urgent.ph, NOT company.ph
Real CEO wouldn't use alternate email for wire transfers
Discouraging phone verification is major red flag
Urgent international transfers without proper process
No standard wire transfer documentation
Convenient excuse for being unreachable
verification_tips: ALWAYS verify wire transfers via phone or in-person
Call CEO's known number regardless of email instructions
Check sender email domain carefully
Follow company wire transfer approval procedures
Verify recipient company with Singapore registry
BEC attacks rely on bypassing verification

subject: PLDT: Upgrade to 1Gbps Fiber - Limited time offer
body:
PLDT Enterprise Fiber Promotion

Exclusive offer for valued corporate customers!

Upgrade your 500 Mbps connection to 1 Gbps Fiber at NO ADDITIONAL COST for 6 months.

Current Plan: 500 Mbps - ₱8,999/month
Upgrade Plan: 1 Gbps - ₱8,999/month (50% discount)

This limited-time promotion expires April 5, 2024.

Accept upgrade offer:
http://pldt-fiber.com.ph/enterprise/upgrade

To process upgrade:
1. Verify account details
2. Confirm current plan
3. Provide payment information
4. Sign digital contract

Offer available only to accounts in good standing. Installation within 5 business days.

PLDT Enterprise Sales Team
Makati Business District Office

phishing_indicators: Too good to be true offer (free upgrade)
Asks to sign 'digital contract' via link
PLDT doesn't use separate fiber domains
ai_analysis.educational_focus: ISP promotional scam - uses attractive upgrade offer to harvest account information and payment details. Real PLDT promotions through official channels.
red_flags: Domain is pldt-fiber.com.ph, NOT pldt.com.ph
Free double speed upgrade is suspiciously generous
Real PLDT promotions announced through official channels
Requesting payment info for 'upgrade' is suspicious
Limited-time pressure tactic
Digital contract signing via email link is unsafe
verification_tips: Contact PLDT Enterprise Hotline: (02) 8888-0-101
Check official PLDT website for promotions
Visit PLDT business center to verify offer
Real upgrades processed through account manager
PLDT uses pldt.com.ph or pldthome.com only

subject: DTI: Business name expired - Renew within 48 hours
body:
Department of Trade and Industry
Republic of the Philippines

BUSINESS NAME EXPIRATION ALERT

Your business name registration has EXPIRED.

Business: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES
Registration: DTI-2020-123456-M

phishing_indicators: Creates panic with expired registration claim
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government impersonation with extortion - uses fear of business closure and fines to steal personal information and payments. Real DTI uses dti.gov.ph only.
red_flags: Domain has .org after .gov.ph (fake government site)
Real government sites ONLY use .gov.ph extension
DTI renewal deadline is expiration date, not 4 years after
₱20,000 penalty for renewal is inflated/fake
DTI sends official notices via mail, not email threats
48-hour business closure is unrealistic
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly dti.gov.ph
Check renewal status at bnrs.dti.gov.ph directly
Call DTI Hotline: 751-3330 to verify
Real DTI renewal fee is ₱500, not ₱20,500
Visit DTI office to verify business status
Government agencies don't threaten via email

subject: Payroll System: Verify employment to receive April salary
body:
Phalanx Cyber Academy Technologies Inc.
Payroll Department

IMPORTANT: Employment Verification Required

phishing_indicators: Asks for government ID and TIN numbers

red_flags: Domain is payroll-system.company.ph.net, NOT company.ph
NEVER EVER provide email password to anyone, including HR
Real HR already has your employment information
Requesting government ID and TIN via email is suspicious
Salary threat is pressure tactic
Legitimate payroll doesn't require 'verification' links
verification_tips: Contact HR department directly via phone or in-person
NEVER provide passwords under any circumstances
Real HR uses internal HRIS, not external links
Check with colleagues if this is legitimate
Report suspicious HR emails to IT security immediately
Verify sender domain is exactly company.ph

subject: Pag-IBIG: Employer account suspended - Update now
body:
Home Development Mutual Fund (Pag-IBIG)
Republic of the Philippines

EMPLOYER ACCOUNT SUSPENSION NOTICE

Your Pag-IBIG employer account has been suspended due to incomplete information.

Employer: PHALANX CYBER ACADEMY TECHNOLOGIES INC.

Account must be reactivated by April 7, 2024 or employees cannot access Pag-IBIG benefits.

Pag-IBIG Employer Services
Compliance and Collection Department

phishing_indicators: Asks for employee salaries and personal data
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Government impersonation for mass PII theft - attempts to harvest complete employee database including sensitive personal information. Real Pag-IBIG uses pagibig.gov.ph only.
red_flags: Domain has .com after .gov.ph (fake government site)
Real government sites ONLY use .gov.ph
Pag-IBIG doesn't charge 'reactivation fees'
Requesting all employee salaries and personal data is suspicious
Real compliance issues handled through official letters
Uploading representative ID to website is dangerous
Threatens employee benefits to create urgency
verification_tips: Verify domain is exactly pagibig.gov.ph
Check employer account at Virtual Pag-IBIG directly
Call Pag-IBIG Hotline: 8-724-4244 to verify
Real Pag-IBIG sends official correspondence via mail
Never submit employee PII via email links
Visit nearest Pag-IBIG branch to verify account status
